name: multinucleate
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a cell) having more than one nucleus (= the part of a cell that controls its growth): Multinucleate giant cells may also appear in lymph follicles. We detected significant differences in the number of multi-nucleate cells in the two age groups. Synonyms
multinuclear
multinucleated
More examplesFewer examplesSome multinucleate cells contained two equivalently sized nuclei positioned adjacent to one another.Each nucleus in a multinucleate cell could contain a complete and separately enclosed set of chromosomes.Many blastomeres either lack any nuclear material or are multinucleate. Only a few tissues in the human body contain polyploid multi-nucleate cells.The examination revealed only a small minority of multinucleate eggs.
